name: Wound Bandaging
description: Basic wound care and bandaging technique
warning: For severe bleeding, call 911 immediately. This is for minor to moderate wounds.
emergency_notes: Apply direct pressure to control bleeding
Elevate the wound above heart level if possible
If bleeding doesn't stop after 10 minutes of pressure, call 911

steps.title: Assess the Wound
steps.description: Evaluate severity and type of wound
detailed_instructions: Check how deep the wound is
Assess amount of bleeding
Look for embedded objects (do NOT remove)
Determine if 911 is needed
steps.voice_prompt: Assess the wound. Check the depth and amount of bleeding. If bleeding is severe or pulsating, call nine one one immediately.
steps.critical_warning: For arterial bleeding (pulsating blood), call 911 immediately

steps.title: Wash Hands
detailed_instructions: Wash hands with soap and water for 20 seconds
If no water available, use hand sanitizer
Put on gloves if available
Keep the area as clean as possible
steps.voice_prompt: Wash your hands thoroughly with soap and water. Use gloves if available.

steps.title: Stop the Bleeding
steps.description: Apply direct pressure with clean cloth
detailed_instructions: Use a clean cloth or gauze
Apply firm, direct pressure on wound
Hold pressure for at least 5 minutes
Do not peek to check if bleeding stopped
Elevate wound above heart level if possible
steps.voice_prompt: Apply direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth. Hold firm pressure for at least five minutes without releasing.
steps.critical_warning: Do not remove cloth if it becomes soaked - add more on top

steps.title: Clean the Wound
detailed_instructions: Rinse wound gently with clean water
Remove any visible dirt or debris
Do NOT use hydrogen peroxide or iodine on deep wounds
Pat dry with clean cloth
Do not scrub the wound
steps.voice_prompt: Gently rinse the wound with clean water to remove dirt. Pat dry with a clean cloth.

steps.title: Apply Antibiotic Ointment
steps.description: Apply thin layer of antibiotic ointment
detailed_instructions: Apply a thin layer of antibiotic ointment
Use products like Neosporin if available
Spread evenly over wound
Skip if person is allergic
steps.voice_prompt: Apply a thin layer of antibiotic ointment to the wound if available.

steps.title: Cover with Bandage
detailed_instructions: Use sterile gauze pad for larger wounds
Use adhesive bandage for small cuts
Cover entire wound
Secure with medical tape if needed
Not too tight - should allow circulation
steps.voice_prompt: Cover the wound with a sterile bandage. Make sure it covers the entire wound but is not too tight.

steps.title: Monitor and Care
detailed_instructions: Change bandage daily or when wet/dirty
Watch for signs of infection: redness, swelling, pus, fever
Keep wound clean and dry
Seek medical attention if wound doesn't heal
See doctor if signs of infection appear
steps.voice_prompt: Change the bandage daily. Watch for signs of infection like increased redness, swelling, or pus. Seek medical attention if these occur.
